channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Billionaire investor Ray Dalio warns the U.S. won’t ‘be competitive in manufacturing with China in our lifetime’
item.description: The Bridgewater Associates founder argued China will continue to have the edge in producing applications for AI chips compared to the U.S.

item.title: Home sellers are ‘waking up to reality’ and are slashing prices to combat stubbornly high mortgage rates
item.description: Realtor.com’s chief economist predicts “further price softening” for the spring.

item.title: The U.S. is the world’s largest oil producer. Why does it still import crude?
XRP and Solana soar then falter as Trump announces plans for a multi-asset crypto reserve
item.description: The president said that XRP, SOL and ADA will be included in a national crypto stockpile with Bitcoin and Ethereum.

item.title: The man who fixed Social Security when it went broke in the ‘80s has some advice
Options traders are bracing for a stock-market crash
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent sees inflation plummeting to the Federal Reserve’s 2% target despite Trump’s tariffs
item.description: Bessent blamed “four years of disastrous policies,” for scorching inflation, claimed the current administration was working everyday to lower prices, ...

item.title: Here’s what the U.S. exports to Canada and Mexico
Trump’s proposed tariffs have already hurt the U.S. auto industry
Chipotle’s CEO says the company will absorb any price increases as tariffs on Mexico are set to hit 50% of its avocado supply
item.description: Scott Boatwright didn’t rule out that prices could rise if costs become a “significant headwind.”
